oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Voucher for camp equipage
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Military equipment & supplies; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office; Confederate States of America -- Army --Supplies and stores
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This one-page printed and handwritten document that begins as a Form No. 2 requisition conveying a request for camp articles from Lieutenant Colonel C. D. Venable of the 5th Tennessee Regiment, C.S.A., to J. E. Ray, Regimental Quartermaster of the 5th, concludes with voucher or receipt information confirming that the request has been filled.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the world of Civil War Quartermaster documentation, vouchers reflect individual transactions in the field and are attached to Abstracts as supporting documents. Abstracts provide a more comprehensive statement of accounting or inventory and are combined to produce summary documents, referred to as Reports or Returns, that would then be sent in to the seat of government.
